citations.narrative:
On December 12, 2023, an employee moved an adult eastern screech-owl (Olmstead) to his enclosure without a leash
following an education program, resulting in the animal's escape from the facility. Despite extensive efforts, the animal
was not recovered. Improper handling of animals can cause trauma or harm, leading to escape, injury, and/or death. The
facility must ensure that handling of all animals is done as expeditiously and carefully as possible in a manner that does
not cause trauma, physical harm, or unnecessary discomfort. Corrective actions have been implemented at the time of
the inspection.

On July 1, 2024, an adult barred owl (Rembrandt) was found deceased in the primary enclosure. On July 2, 2024, an
adult barred owl (Sundew) was found deceased in the primary enclosure. Facility speculation on cause of death was
predation by a mink. If other animals are permitted to enter the primary enclosure, these animals can cause injury and/or
death to those animals within the enclosure. Primary enclosures must be constructed and maintained so that they restrict
other animals from entering said enclosures. Corrective actions have been implemented at the time of the inspection.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
n

narrative:
2.131(b)(1)  Critical
   
Handling of animals. 
On December 12, 2023, an employee moved an adult eastern screech-owl (Olmstead) to his enclosure without a leash 
following an education program, resulting in the animal's escape from the facility. Despite extensive efforts, the animal 
was not recovered. Improper handling of animals can cause trauma or harm, leading to escape, injury, and/or death. The 
facility must ensure that handling of all animals is done as expeditiously and carefully as possible in a manner that does 
not cause trauma, physical harm, or unnecessary discomfort. Corrective actions have been implemented at the time of 
the inspection. 
3.153(a)(1)(iv)  Critical
   
Primary enclosures. 
On July 1, 2024, an adult barred owl (Rembrandt) was found deceased in the primary enclosure. On July 2, 2024, an 
adult barred owl (Sundew) was found deceased in the primary enclosure. Facility speculation on cause of death was 
predation by a mink. If other animals are permitted to enter the primary enclosure, these animals can cause injury and/or 
death to those animals within the enclosure. Primary enclosures must be constructed and maintained so that they restrict 
other animals from entering said enclosures. Corrective actions have been implemented at the time of the inspection. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
